alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 8:15PM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Corson and Dewey Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 11 AM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes this week. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
